title: How to Enable Attribute Editor Tab in Active Directory on Windows

steps.title: Click the Windows Start menu.
steps.content: Click the Windows Start menu. It's the button with the Windows icon at the bottom-left corner or center of your screen.

steps.title: Type Active Directory Users and Computers.
steps.content: Type Active Directory Users and Computers . This displays Active Directory Users and Computers in the Start menu.

steps.title: Click Active Directory Users and Computers.
steps.content: Click Active Directory Users and Computers . It's the program that has an icon that resembles a yellow pages phone book. This opens Active Directory Users and Computers. If you don't have Active Directory Users and Computers installed on your computer, contact your system administrator. This is a tool available on Professional and Enterprise editions of Windows. You won't be able to install this on Home or Standard editions. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click View.
steps.content: Click View . You can find this in the top toolbar, between Action and Help . A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Advanced Features.
steps.content: Click Advanced Features . This will add a checkmark next to the option. If you already see a checkmark, skip this step.

steps.title: Right-click the object you want to edit.
steps.content: Right-click the object you want to edit. User-objects are listed in the main window of Active Directory. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Properties.
steps.content: Click Properties . This opens the properties window of the user-object.

steps.title: Click Attribute Editor.
steps.content: Click Attribute Editor . With Advanced Features checked, the Attribute Editor tab is displayed at the top of an user-object properties window. [2] X Research source
